sub_topic: Identifying the perfect matching in a graph.
message_1: Consider a Bipartite graph with 6 vertices on one side and 7 vertices on the other side. Determine the number of perfect matchings that can be formed in this graph.
message_2:
A perfect matching in a bipartite graph is a set of edges that connects each vertex in one partition to exactly one vertex in the other partition. In this case, since there are 6 vertices on one side and 7 vertices on the other side, a perfect matching is not possible because there will always be one unmatched vertex on the side with 7 vertices.

Therefore, the number of perfect matchings that can be formed in this bipartite graph is 0.
